title: Vintage Calculators
description: From adding machines to pocket calculators, how well do you remember doing the math?

questions.question: What mechanical device, commonly found on office desks through the 1960s, used a hand crank to perform addition and subtraction?
What calculation tool, consisting of a ruler with a sliding center strip, was widely used by engineers and scientists before electronic calculators?
Which Texas Instruments product, introduced in 1972, was one of the first affordable handheld electronic calculators?
What did early electronic calculators use to display numbers before LCD screens became common?
What brand became synonymous with scientific calculators used by students and engineers, known by its initials 'HP'?
What method of entering calculations, used by Hewlett-Packard calculators, required users to enter numbers before the operation?
What type of large, desk-sized mechanical calculator, popular in offices from the 1920s to 1960s, printed results on paper tape?
Approximately how much did an early pocket electronic calculator cost when first introduced around 1970?
What ancient counting device, using beads on rods, was still used in some stores and classrooms well into the 20th century?
What solar-powered feature, added to calculators in the early 1980s, eliminated the need for batteries?
What Casio product line, introduced in the 1980s, combined a calculator with a wristwatch?
What word could children spell by typing '07734' and turning a calculator upside down?
Which company produced the Curta, a remarkable cylindrical mechanical calculator small enough to hold in one hand?
What type of display technology, using small neon-filled tubes that displayed glowing orange numerals, was used in early electronic calculators?
What classroom debate erupted in the 1970s when electronic calculators became affordable enough for students?
options: Whether to replace teachers with computers
Whether calculators should be allowed in math class
